thread.title: UPDATE 1-Health insurer Humana's profit beats as memberships rise
thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Health insurer Humana's profit beats as memberships rise | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Health insurer Humana's profit beats as memberships rise
text:
(Adds details, background, shares)
July 29 (Reuters) - Health insurer Humana Inc reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit, helped by strong growth in memberships in its Medicare Advantage business for individuals.
Humana, which agreed to be bought by larger health insurer Aetna Inc for $37 billion this month, also reaffirmed its full-year profit forecast.
The company said it added 350,300 more customers to its Medicare Advantage program for individuals, up 15 percent from a year earlier.
The managed care sector is in a phase of rapid consolidation as insurers seek to cut costs and negotiate with doctors and hospitals over pricing.
Anthem Inc said it would buy Cigna Corp for $54.2 billion to create the largest U.S. health insurer by membership.
Humana's consolidated benefit ratio, a measure comparing how much it spends on medical claims with the premiums it brings in, deteriorated 210 basis points in the quarter from 83.1 percent a year ago.
Investors are keeping a close eye on insurers and hospitals for signs that medical use and costs are on the rise.
Net income rose to $431 million, or $2.85 per share, in the second quarter ended June 30, from $344 million, or $2.19 per share, a year earlier.
Excluding tax benefits from the sale of Concerta Inc, Humana earned $1.67 per share, marginally above the average analyst estimate of $1.63 per share, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.
The company reported revenue of $13.73 billion, which missed average analyst estimate of $13.81 billion.
Humana shares, which have gained nearly 29 percent this year up to Tuesday's close, were little changed in premarket trading. (Reporting by Vidya L Nathan in Bengaluru, Editing by Anil D'Silva)
